column4: argh, over half the stuff I try to compile that's for linux, won't compile in ubuntu
what are you trying to build ?
whats the problem with it ?
you could remove it - but I'd advise you to just wait for ubuntu to fix it
if you install your own version of pidgen you'll lose package manager awareness of pidgen and as pidgin is linked into the desktop packages, I don't think thats the best thing to do
is there anyway I can keep my current configuration and just copy over the new version parts?
how quick the response will be will most probably depend on how serious the fault is, I would expect pidgin to be a quick turn around
as pidgin is a core part of ubuntu , and icq a core function, I think it's a reasonable assumption to say this is on the high list
one that has drivers in built into the kernel, no 3rd party. Intel are normally a solid chipset
the products change on a regular basis hence why anyone listed in the hcl list I posted you would be safe
if you read the information given to you which is very speicifc, before asking for something more specific you'll get a better result
Maybe I'm lazy ;)
then you won't get very far
what's the point of asking for help if your too lazy to absorb the advice
I would like the brand/model of wifi card that's just common available at someplace like walmart ;P I had to compile drivers for my current modem, which annoyed me
and I gave you a list
hence why I find your lack of reading the list and subsiquent "I want something more specific" time wasting
the list doesn't answer my full question. Or at least the intent of my question.
you've not read it
don't lie - you admited you've not read it
the list of wirless adaptors is listed, has "works out of the box" tick box which wouldn't be more clear
ok - so it lists cards supported out of the box - what part of that does not answer your question
how are we meant to know walmarts stock - take the list and see which one walmart sells
